name: (1E)-N-hydroxy-1-(4,7,7-trimethylbicyclo[2.2.1]hept-2-yl)propan-1-imine
source: Karthikeyan M.; Glen R.C.; Bender A. General melting point prediction based on a diverse compound dataset and artificial neural networks. J. Chem. Inf. Model.; 2005; 45(3); 581-878
Reason: 1-ethylpiperazine-2,3-dione base, with a melting point around 106°C, due to the presence of two carbonyl groups, which can participate in dipole interactions and rigidify the structure, raising the melting point by approximately +20°C for each carbonyl. The methyl group introduces a rigid structure, which can participate in hydrogen bonding, raising the melting point by approximately +5°C. The trimethylbicyclo[2.2.1]hept-2-yl group introduces a rigid structure, which can participate in hydrogen bonding, raising the melting point by approximately +5°C. The propan-1-imine base introduces a rigid structure, which can participate in hydrogen bonding, raising the melting point by approximately +5°C.
